body_html:
I am getting the same error. I checked bazel version and its 3.1:
Build label: 0.3.1 Build target: bazel-out/local-fastbuild/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar Build time: Fri Jul 29 09:09:52 2016 (1469783392) Build timestamp: 1469783392 Build timestamp as int: 1469783392
I am on commit 56a8e1. CUDA 8.0 with CUDNN 5.0 with Nvidia GTX 1080 (driver version 367.44), and Ubuntu 16.04.1 (only combination that works with GTX 1080 for me).

This should address the problem: ea07715

But at this moment, installation attempts to download the file below but the link is broken:
http://www.ijg.org/files/jpegsrc.v9a.tar.gz
I'll remove if the link outage is temporary or file under new issue. ?

body:
I am getting the same error.  I checked bazel version and its 3.1:
`
Build label: 0.3.1
Build target: bazel-out/local-fastbuild/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Fri Jul 29 09:09:52 2016 (1469783392)
Build timestamp: 1469783392
Build timestamp as int: 1469783392
`
I am on commit 56a8e1.  CUDA 8.0 with CUDNN 5.0 with Nvidia GTX 1080 (driver version 367.44), and Ubuntu 16.04.1 (only combination that works with GTX 1080 for me). 

This should address the problem: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/ea0771512af531c2a3fa1f60d3e6dd2b47384e99

But at this moment, installation attempts to download the file below but the link is broken: 
http://www.ijg.org/files/jpegsrc.v9a.tar.gz
I'll remove if the link outage is temporary or file under new issue. ?
